thread.title: Akurut Pauline crowned Miss Tourism 2015Travelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Akurut Pauline crowned Miss Tourism 2015Travelandtourworld.com
text:
Akurut Pauline crowned Miss Tourism 2015 Published on : Sunday, August 30, 2015
The pageant started around 8pm with a band serenading the audience before the emcees of the evening, Roger Mugisha and Flavia Tumusiime officially began what would be an exciting six-hour ride.
After a tumultuous journey, Akurut Pauline was crowned Miss Tourism 2015 beating 21 other girls who had made it to the finale.
The 22 finalists showcased cultural wear and creative wear before eliminating 12. The remaining 10 went through a maze of questions and scrutiny from the judges. Some of the contestants answered the questions with confidence as others struggled. The girls furthermore underwent a set of questions where Akurut Pauline was announced Miss Tourism 2015.
Thereafter, there was a bit of an error from the judges who had mistakenly announced the top 5 winners.
Miss Tourism Ankole, Sheila Kirabo was 2nd Runner Up and Miss Tourism Karamoja, Nyangan Karen was 1st Runner Up.
The highlight of the evening was a blind 20-year-old girl, Bahati Aisha who was crowned Miss Tourism Independent. She had various talents including hairstyling which she did on stage, styling Flavia Tumusiimeâ€™s hair.
Bahati beat off competition from Joan Namubiru who chose to showcase her dancing skills.
They were rewarded with shs 200,000 each and gift hampers.
